intro: Nemacaulis, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of a single species, Nemacaulis tenuifolia, which is native to the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
